p: Potentilla alba L. is a member of the Potentilla genus belonging to the family Rosaceae. This perennial herbaceous plant is native to Central, Southern, and Eastern parts of Europe and introduced to the U.S. [ 8, 10, 11]. Phytochemical studies determined that the Potentilla alba plant possesses several biologically active constituents, including flavonoids, polyphenols, phenol carboxylic acids, triterpenes, tannins, and polysaccharides [ 8, 12].
